meanings.sent1: The cockered cat lounged on a velvet cushion all day.
meanings.sent2: The princess's cockered lifestyle included daily massages and gourmet meals.
meanings.sent3: The cockered puppy refused to eat anything but imported organic dog food.
meanings.sent4: Her cockered attitude made her unprepared for the challenges of the real world.
meanings.sent5: The cockered child cried when they didn't get the latest toy.

meanings.definition: To treat with excessive indulgence or attention.
meanings.sent1: She cockered her pet rabbit by hand-feeding it fresh vegetables every day.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy heiress cockered her husband with expensive gifts and lavish vacations.
meanings.sent3: The chef cockered the VIP guest by preparing a special off-menu dish.
meanings.sent4: He cockered his vintage car, meticulously cleaning and polishing it every weekend.
meanings.sent5: The coach cockered the star player, giving them extra training sessions and personalized tips.
